description: From Old Norse haf (“the sea”). Cognate with Danish hav, Old English hæf (Etymology 2).

entries.meaning: (fishing, Shetland, Scotland) the open sea, especially as a place to fish
(fishing, Shetland) the practice of sea fishing for such as cod, ling and tusk
examples: Although men concentrated at the main haaf stations during the summer fishing season, they reverted to their homes in crofting townships for the remainder of the year.
